(9) The Registrar may permit **correction of any error or amendment** of a notice of opposition or a counter-statement upon request, on terms deemed fit.
Sections.Registrar to consider grounds of opposit: —The Registrar shall consider all grounds of opposition and, after giving reasons, **by order, uphold or reject the opposition**.
Sections.Registration of essentially derived vari:
—(1) An application for registration of an **essentially derived variety (EDV)** of specified genera/species shall be made to the Registrar by a person specified in section 14 and in the manner of section 18 (substituting 'variety' with 'essentially derived variety'), along with prescribed documents and fees.
(2) The Registrar, if satisfied, shall forward the application with his report and documents to the **Authority**.
(3) The Authority shall get the EDV **examined by conducting tests** and following prescribed procedure to determine if it is derived from the **initial variety**.
(4) If the Authority is satisfied that the EDV is derived from the initial variety based on the test report, it may **direct the Registrar to register** the EDV, and the Registrar must comply.
(5) If the Authority is not satisfied, it shall **refuse the application**.
(6) The rights of the breeder of a variety (section 28) apply to the EDV breeder, provided the **authorisation** by the breeder of the initial variety to the EDV breeder may be subject to **mutually agreed terms and conditions**.
(7) An EDV shall not be registered unless it satisfies the requirements of **section 15** (DUS/denomination requirements), substituting 'variety' with 'essentially derived variety'.
(8) Upon registration, the Registrar shall issue a **certificate of registration** in the prescribed form, sealed with the Registry seal, and send copies to the Authority and other prescribed authorities.
Sections.Issue of certificate of registration:
—(1) When an application for a variety (other than an EDV) is accepted, and either:
(a) the application was **not opposed** and the opposition time expired; or
(b) the application was opposed and the **opposition was rejected**,
the Registrar shall **register the variety**.
(2) Upon registration, the Registrar shall issue a **certificate of registration** (prescribed form, sealed) to the applicant and send a copy to the **Authority for determination of benefit sharing** and to other prescribed authorities. The maximum time for issuing the certificate shall be prescribed.
(3) If registration is not completed within **twelve months** from application date due to applicant's default, the Registrar may, after notice, treat the application as **abandoned** unless completed within the specified time.
(4) The Registrar may **amend the register or certificate** to correct a **clerical error or obvious mistake**.
(5) The Registrar has power to issue **directions to protect the interests of a breeder** against abusive acts by a third party during the period between application filing and Authority's decision.
(6) The certificate of registration (under this section or section 23(8)) is valid for **nine years** (trees/vines) and **six years** (other crops). It may be reviewed and renewed for the remaining period on payment of fees, subject to the total validity not exceeding:
(i) **eighteen years** (trees and vines) from registration date;
(ii) **fifteen years** (extant variety) from the date of notification under section 5 of the Seeds Act, 1966; and
(iii) **fifteen years** (other cases) from registration date.
Sections.Publication of list of varieties: —The Authority shall, at appropriate intervals, **publish the list of varieties** that have been registered during that interval.
Sections.Determination of benefit sharing by Auth:
—(1) On receipt of the registration certificate copy, the Authority shall publish its contents and **invite claims of benefit sharing** to the registered variety in the prescribed manner.
(2) Any eligible person, group, firm, or governmental/non-governmental organisation may submit a **claim of benefit sharing** in the prescribed form, period, and with prescribed fees.
> **Proviso**: Claimants must be Indian citizens/firms/organisations formed/established in India.
(3) The Authority sends a copy of the claim to the breeder, who may submit an **opposition** within the prescribed period/manner.
(4) The Authority shall dispose of the claim after giving the parties an **opportunity of being heard**.
(5) In the order, the Authority shall explicitly indicate the **amount of benefit sharing** (if any) and consider:
(a) the **extent and nature of use of the claimant's genetic material** in the variety development;
(b) the **commercial utility and market demand** of the variety.
(6) The determined benefit sharing amount shall be **deposited by the breeder into the National Gene Fund** (section 45(1)(a)).
(7) The benefit sharing amount shall be recoverable as an **arrear of land revenue** by the District Magistrate, based on a reference made by the Authority.
Sections.Breeder to deposit seeds or propagating:
—(1) The breeder must deposit the **required quantity of seeds or propagating material** (including parental line seeds) of the registered variety in the **National Gene Bank** for reproduction purposes, at the **breeder's expense** and within the time specified by regulations.
(2) The deposit shall be made to the **National Gene Bank specified by the Authority**.
Sections.Registration to confer right:
—(1) A certificate of registration confers an **exclusive right** on the breeder/successor/agent/licensee to **produce, sell, market, distribute, import or export the variety**.
> **Proviso**: For an **extant variety**, unless a breeder establishes his right, the **Central Government** (or State Government if notified under the Seeds Act) shall be deemed the owner of such right.
(2) A breeder may **authorise** any person to deal with the registered variety subject to limitations/conditions specified by regulations.
(3) Every authorisation must be in the **prescribed form**.
(4) An agent or licensee who becomes entitled to deal with the variety must **apply to the Registrar to register their title** (prescribed manner/fees). The Registrar registers the title and enters the particulars and conditions/restrictions in the Register.
> **Proviso**: If the entitlement validity is disputed, the Registrar may refuse registration, refer the matter to the Authority, and withhold registration until the dispute is determined.
(5) The Registrar issues a **certificate of registration** to the agent/licensee after registration, which is **conclusive proof** of such entitlement and conditions/restrictions.
(6) A registered agent/licensee is entitled to call upon the breeder/successor to take proceedings to **prevent infringement**. If the breeder/successor refuses or neglects to do so within three months, the agent/licensee may institute infringement proceedings in their own name, making the breeder/successor a defendant (subject to any subsisting agreement).
(7) A breeder/successor added as a defendant is **not liable for any costs** unless they enter an appearance and participate.
(8) Registration under this section **does not confer a right on a registered agent or licensee to transfer such right further**.
(9) The terms of registration (in addition to sub-section (4)) may be:
(a) **Varied** by the Registrar on application of the registered breeder/successor (as regards the variety or conditions/restrictions);
(b) **Cancelled** by the Registrar on application of the registered breeder/successor, or registered agent/licensee;
(c) **Cancelled** by the Registrar on application of any other person on grounds including misrepresentation, failure to disclose material facts, or that registration ought not to have been effected due to another's contractual right;
(d) **Cancelled** by the Registrar on application of the breeder/successor if an agreement stipulation with the agent/licensee is not being enforced/complied with;
(e) **Cancelled** by the Registrar on application of any person on the ground that the variety relating to the registration is **no longer existing**.
(10) The Registrar shall issue **notice** of every application under this section to the registered breeder/successor and to each registered agent/licensee (not being the applicant).
(11) Before making any order under sub-section (9), the Registrar shall forward the application and any objections received to the **Authority for consideration**. The Authority shall issue directions to the Registrar after inquiry, and the Registrar shall dispose of the application accordingly.
Sections.Exclusion of certain varieties:
—(1) **No registration** of a variety shall be made where prevention of commercial exploitation is necessary to protect **public order, public morality, human, animal and plant life and health**, or to avoid **serious prejudice to the environment**.
(2) The Central Government shall specify the **genera or species** for registration of varieties (other than extant and farmers’ varieties) by notification.
(3) **No variety** of any genera or species which involves any technology which is **injurious to the life or health of human beings, animals or plants** shall be registered.
> **Explanation**: "any technology" includes **genetic use restriction technology and terminator technology**.
(4) The Central Government shall **not delete** any genera or species from the notified list except in the **public interest**.
(5) Any variety belonging to a genera or species excluded under sub-section (4) is **not eligible for protection** under this Act.
Sections.Researcher’s rights:
—Nothing in this Act shall prevent:
(a) The **use of any registered variety for conducting experiment or research**; or
(b) The **use of a variety as an initial source** of variety for creating other varieties.
> **Proviso**: The breeder's authorization is required where the **repeated use** of the registered variety as a **parental line** is necessary for commercial production of the newly developed variety.
Sections.Special provisions relating to applicati:
—(1) The Central Government may declare a country a **convention country** by notification if it affords similar privileges to Indian citizens as granted to its own citizens, to fulfill a treaty, convention, or arrangement.
(2) If a person applies for a breeder's right in a convention country, and then applies for registration in India **within twelve months** of the convention country application date, the variety, if registered in India, shall be registered as of the **date of the convention country application**.
(3) If applications were made in two or more convention countries, the twelve-month period is reckoned from the **earlier or earliest** of those applications.
(4) Nothing in this Act entitles the breeder of a registered variety to claim for infringement of rights (other than protected under this Act) that took place **prior to the date of application for registration** under this Act.
Sections.Provisions as to reciprocity: —If a convention country (declared under section 31(1)) does not accord Indian citizens the same rights in registration/protection of a variety as it accords to its nationals, then **no national of that country** shall be entitled to apply for or get a variety registered under this Act (solely or jointly with any other person).
Sections.Surrender of certificate of registration:
—(1) A breeder may, by giving notice to the Registrar, **offer to surrender** his certificate of registration.
(2) The Registrar shall notify every registered agent or licensee relating to the certificate.
(3) Any agent or licensee may give notice of **opposition to the surrender** within the prescribed period. The Registrar shall intimate the breeder.
(4) If the Registrar is satisfied, after hearing the applicant and opponents, that the certificate may properly be surrendered, he may **accept the offer and by order revoke the certificate of registration**.
Sections.Payment of annual fees and forfeiture of:
—(1) The Authority may, with prior Central Government approval, impose an **annual fee** on every breeder, agent, and licensee (determined on the basis of benefit/royalty gained) for the retention of their registration.
(2) If a person **fails to deposit the fee for up to two consecutive years**, the Authority shall issue notice. If the direction in the notice is not complied with, the Authority shall declare **all protection admissible under the registration certificate forfeited**.
(3) Arrears of the imposed fee are deemed to be **arrears of land revenue** and are recoverable accordingly.
Sections.Power to cancel or change registration a:
—(1) On application by any **aggrieved person**, the Registrar may order the **cancellation or change of any certificate of registration** on the ground of contravention of the Act or failure to observe a condition of registration.
(2) Any person aggrieved by an **absence, omission, entry without sufficient cause, or wrongly remaining entry** in the Register may apply to the Registrar, who may order for **making, expunging, or varying the entry**.
(3) The Registrar may decide any question necessary or expedient for the **rectification of the Register**.
(4) The Registrar may, on his **own motion**, make any order referred to in sub-section (1) or (2) after giving notice and an opportunity of being heard to the concerned parties.
Sections.Alteration of denomination of a register:
—(1) The breeder may apply to the Registrar to delete, add to, or alter the denomination in a manner **not substantially affecting the identity** thereof. The Registrar may refuse or grant leave on terms/limitations to avoid conflict with other registered breeders' rights.
(2) The Registrar may advertise the application. If any person gives notice of **opposition** within the prescribed time, the Registrar shall decide the matter after hearing the parties.
(3) Where leave is granted, the altered denomination shall be **advertised** unless the application was already advertised.
Sections.Farmers’ rights:
(1) Notwithstanding anything contained in this Act,
(i) a farmer who has bred or developed a new variety shall be **entitled for registration and other protection** in like manner as a breeder.
(ii) the **farmers’ variety** shall be entitled for registration if the application includes the declaration specified in section 18(1)(h).
(iii) a farmer engaged in the **conservation of genetic resources** (land races and wild relatives) and their improvement through selection and preservation shall be entitled to **recognition and reward from the Gene Fund** in the prescribed manner, provided the material has been used as donors of genes in registrable varieties.
(iv) a farmer shall be deemed to be entitled to **save, use, sow, resow, exchange, share or sell his farm produce, including seed** of a protected variety, in the same manner as before the Act's commencement. **Proviso**: The farmer shall not be entitled to sell **branded seed** of a protected variety.
> **Explanation**: "branded seed" means seed put in a package or container and labelled to indicate it is of a variety protected under this Act.
(2) If propagating material of a registered variety is sold to a farmer/group/organisation, the breeder must **disclose the expected performance under given conditions**. If the material fails to provide such performance, the farmer/group/organisation may claim **compensation** before the Authority. The Authority, after notice and hearing the parties, may direct the breeder to pay compensation as deemed fit.
Sections.Certain information to be given in appli:
(1) A breeder or other person applying for variety registration must disclose information regarding the **use of genetic material conserved by any tribal or rural families** in the breeding or development of such variety.
(2) If the Registrar is satisfied that the breeder or person has **wilfully and knowingly concealed** such information, the Registrar may **reject the application** for registration.
Sections.Rights of communities:
(1) Any person or group of persons, or any governmental/non-governmental organisation, may file a claim on behalf of any **village or local community in India** for the **contribution** of its people in the **evolution of any variety** at a notified centre, for the purpose of staking a claim on behalf of the community.
(2) The notified centre may verify the claim, and if satisfied that the community **contributed significantly** to the evolution of a registered variety, it shall report its findings to the Authority.
(3) If the Authority is satisfied, after inquiry and giving notice and hearing the breeder, it may, by order, grant a **sum of compensation** to be paid to the claimant (subject to any limit notified by the Central Government).
(4) Any compensation granted shall be **deposited by the breeder in the Gene Fund**.
(5) The compensation granted shall be deemed to be an **arrear of land revenue** and recoverable accordingly by the Authority.
Sections.Protection of innocent infringement:
Notwithstanding anything contained in this Act,
(i) a right established under this Act shall **not be deemed to be infringed by a farmer** who was not aware of the existence of such right at the time of infringement; and
(ii) a court shall not grant a relief in a suit for infringement (section 65), nor shall any cognizance of an offence under this Act be taken, against a farmer who proves that at the time of the infringement **he was not aware of the existence of the right** so infringed.
Sections.Authorisation of farmers’ variety: Notwithstanding sections 23(6) and 28, where an **essentially derived variety (EDV) is derived from a farmers’ variety**, the authorisation under section 28(2) shall **not be given** by the breeder of such farmers’ variety **except with the consent of the farmers or group/community of farmers** who have contributed to the preservation or development of that variety.
Sections.Exemption from fees:
A **farmer or group of farmers or village community** shall **not be liable to pay any fees** in any proceeding before the Authority or Registrar or the High Court under this Act or its rules.
> **Explanation**: "fees in any proceeding” includes any fees for inspection or for obtaining a copy of any decision, order, or document.
Sections.Gene Fund:
(1) The Central Government shall constitute the **National Gene Fund**. The following shall be credited thereto:
(a) **Benefit sharing** received from the breeder of a registered variety or essentially derived variety/propagating material.
(b) The **annual fee payable to the Authority as royalty** under section 35(1).
(c) The **compensation deposited** in the Gene Fund under section 41(4).
(d) **Contribution** from any national and international organisation and other sources.
(2) The Gene Fund shall be applied in the prescribed manner for meeting:
(a) Any amount payable as **benefit sharing** under section 26(5).
(b) The **compensation payable** under section 41(3).
(c) The **expenditure for supporting the conservation and sustainable use of genetic resources** (including *in-situ* and *ex-situ* collections) and for strengthening Panchayat capability in such conservation and use.
(d) The **expenditure of schemes relating to benefit sharing** framed under section 46.
(1) The Central Government shall frame **one or more schemes** for the purposes of section 41 (Rights of communities) and section 45(2)(d) (Gene Fund utilisation).
(2) The scheme may specifically provide for:
(a) The **registration of claims** for section 41 purposes and related matters.
(b) The **processing of such claims** for securing their enforcement.
(c) The **maintenance of records and Registers** in respect of such claims.
(d) The **utilisation/disbursal (including apportionment)** of any amounts received in satisfaction of such claims.
(e) The **procedure for disbursal/apportionment** by the Authority in case of a dispute.
(f) The **utilisation of benefit sharing** for the purposes relating to breeding, discovery, or development of varieties.
(g) The **maintenance and audit of accounts** for the amounts referred to in clause (d).
Sections.Power of Authority to make order for com:
(1) At any time **after the expiry of three years** from the date of registration, any interested person may apply to the Authority alleging that the **reasonable requirements of the public** for seed or propagating material of the variety **have not been satisfied** or that the material is **not available at a reasonable price**. The application prays for the grant of a **compulsory licence** for production, distribution, and sale.
(2) The application must state the applicant's interest, prescribed particulars, and the facts on which it is based.
(3) The Authority, after consultation with the Central Government, and if satisfied after giving the breeder an opportunity to file opposition and hearing the parties, may **order the breeder to grant a licence** to the applicant upon terms and conditions it deems fit. A copy of the order is sent to the Registrar to register the applicant's title as a licensee (section 28(4)).
Sections.When requirement of public deemed to hav:
In determining whether the reasonable requirements of the public for seeds of a variety have not been satisfied (as per section 47(1) or 47(3)), the Authority shall take into account:
(i) The **nature of the variety**, the time elapsed since registration, the **price of the seed**, and the **measures taken by the breeder/licensee** to meet public requirements; and
(ii) The **capacity, ability, and technical competence of the applicant** to produce and market the variety to meet public requirements.
Sections.Adjournment of application for grant of:
(1) If a registered breeder, with a pending compulsory licence application (section 47), requests an adjournment in writing, stating that due to a **reasonable factor** they have been unable to produce adequate seed/propagating material on a commercial scale, the Authority may, if satisfied with the ground, **adjourn the hearing for a period not exceeding twelve months in aggregate**.
(2) No adjournment shall be granted unless the Authority is satisfied that the breeder has taken **immediate measures** to meet the reasonable requirements of the public for the seed/propagating material.
Sections.Duration of compulsory licence: The Authority shall determine the ** duration of the compulsory licence**, which may vary case-by-case considering gestation periods and other relevant factors, but **shall not exceed the total remaining period of the variety's protection**. When granted, the prescribed authority shall make the reproductive material of the variety stored in the National Gene Bank or any other centre available to the compulsory licensee.
Sections.Authority to settle terms and conditions:
(1) When determining the terms and conditions of a compulsory licence, the Authority shall endeavour to secure:
(i) **Reasonable compensation to the breeder**, having regard to the nature of the variety, the expenditure incurred in breeding/developing it, and other relevant factors.
(ii) That the compulsory licensee possesses **adequate means to provide the seeds/propagating material to farmers timely and at a reasonable market price**.
(2) No compulsory licence shall authorise the licensee to **import the variety or its material from abroad** where such import would infringe the breeder's rights.
Sections.Revocation of compulsory licence:
(1) The Authority, on its own motion or on application from an aggrieved person, if satisfied that a compulsory licensee has **violated any terms or conditions** or that it's **not appropriate to continue** the licence in public interest, may, after giving the licensee an opportunity to file opposition and be heard, **order the revocation of the licence**.
(2) Upon revocation, the Authority sends a copy of the order to the Registrar to **rectify the entry or correct the Register** accordingly.
Sections.Modification of compulsory licence: The Authority may, on its own motion or on application from a licensee, after providing an opportunity of being heard to the breeder, and if considered in the **public interest**, **modify the terms and conditions** by order. A copy of the order is sent to the Registrar to correct the entries and Register accordingly.
Sections.Grants by Central Government: The Central Government may, after due appropriation by Parliament, make **grants and loans** to the Authority for the purposes of this Act.
Sections.Authority Fund:
(1) A fund called the **Protection of Plant Varieties Authority Account** shall be constituted and credited with:
(a) All **grants and loans** made by the Central Government under section 60.
(b) All **fees received by the Authority and the Registrars** (except the annual fee/royalty under section 35(1)).
(c) All sums received by the Authority from **such other sources** as decided by the Central Government.
(2) The Fund shall be applied for meeting:
(a) The **salaries, allowances, and other remuneration** of the Chairperson, officers, employees, and members' allowances.
(b) The **other expenses** of the Authority in connection with the discharge of its functions and the purposes of this Act.
Sections.Budget, accounts and audit:
(1) The Authority shall prepare a **budget**, maintain **proper accounts and records** (including those of the Gene Fund), and prepare an **annual statement of accounts** in the prescribed form (in consultation with the Comptroller and Auditor-General of India).
(2) The Authority's accounts shall be **audited by the Comptroller and Auditor-General of India (CAG)** at specified intervals. The Authority pays the audit expenditure.
(3) The CAG and his appointees have the same **rights, privileges, and authority** in connection with the audit as the CAG generally has for Government accounts, including the right to demand production of documents and inspect offices.
(4) The certified accounts and the audit report shall be forwarded annually to the Central Government, which shall cause them to be **laid before each House of Parliament**.
Sections.Financial and administrative powers of t: The **Chairperson** shall exercise such **financial and administrative powers** over the Authority's functions as may be prescribed. **Proviso**: The Chairperson may delegate such powers to a member or officer, but the delegate remains under the Chairperson's direction, control, and supervision.
Sections.Infringement:
Subject to the provisions of this Act, a right established under this Act is infringed by a person:
(a) Who, not being the breeder, a registered agent, or a registered licensee, **sells, exports, imports, or produces** such variety **without the permission** of its breeder or the registered licensee/agent, as the case may be; or
(b) Who **uses, sells, exports, imports, or produces any other variety** giving it a **denomination identical with or deceptively similar** to the denomination of a registered variety, in a manner that causes **confusion** in the minds of the general public in identifying the registered variety.
(1) No suit:
(a) for the **infringement** of a registered variety; or
(b) relating to any **right** in a registered variety,
shall be instituted in any court **inferior to a District Court** having jurisdiction to try the suit.
(2) For these purposes, "District Court having jurisdiction" means the District Court within whose local limits the **cause of action arises**.
Sections.Opinion of scientific adviser:
(1) When the court needs to form an opinion on a question of fact or a scientific issue, it may appoint an **independent scientific adviser** to suggest or inquire into and report upon the matter.
(2) The scientific adviser may be paid such **remuneration or expenses** as the court may fix.
Sections.Prohibition to apply the denomination of:
(1) **No person** other than the breeder, a registered licensee, or a registered agent of a registered variety shall **use the denomination** of that variety in the prescribed manner.
(2) A person is deemed to apply the denomination if they apply it:
(a) to the **variety itself**; or
(b) to any **package** in or with which the variety is sold, exposed for sale, or possessed for sale/trade/production; or
(c) to any package or thing in or with which the variety is placed, enclosed, or annexed for sale/trade/production; or
(d) **uses the denomination** in a manner reasonably likely to lead to the belief that the variety or its propagating material is designated or described by that denomination; or
(e) **uses such denomination in any commercial document** (advertisement, invoice, catalogue, etc.) and the variety is delivered pursuant to a request/order made by reference to the denomination as so used.
(3) A denomination is deemed to be applied to a variety whether it is woven in, impressed on, worked into, annexed, or affixed to, such variety or any package/thing.
Sections.Meaning of falsely applying denomination:
(1) A person is deemed to **falsely apply the denomination** of a registered variety who, **without the assent of the breeder**:
(a) **applies such denomination or a deceptively similar denomination** to any variety or package containing such variety; or
(b) **uses any package bearing an identical or deceptively similar denomination** for packing, filling, or wrapping any variety other than the registered variety.
(2) Any denomination falsely applied as mentioned in sub-section (1) is referred to as a **false denomination** in this Act.
(3) In any prosecution for falsely applying a denomination, the **burden of proving the assent of the breeder lies on the accused**.
Sections.Penalty for applying false denomination,:
(1) Any person who:
(a) **applies any false denomination** to a variety; or
(b) indicates the **false name of a country/place or false name/address of the breeder** of a registered variety in the course of trading it,
shall, unless they prove they acted without intent to defraud, be punishable with **imprisonment for a term of not less than three months but up to two years**, or with a **fine of not less than fifty thousand rupees but up to five lakh rupees**, or with **both**.
Sections.Penalty for selling varieties to which f:
Any person who **sells, or exposes for sale, or possesses for sale/trade/production** any variety to which any false denomination is applied, or to which a false indication of the country/place of production or the breeder's name/address has been made, shall, unless they prove one of the following:
(a) they took reasonable precautions and, at the time of the offence, had no reason to suspect the genuineness of the denomination/indication;
(b) on demand by the prosecutor, they gave all information on the person from whom they obtained the variety; or
(c) they otherwise acted innocently,
be punishable with **imprisonment for a term of not less than six months but up to two years**, or with a **fine of not less than fifty thousand rupees but up to five lakh rupees**, or with **both**.
Sections.Penalty for falsely representing a varie: Whoever makes any representation regarding a variety/material not registered under this Act, to the effect that it **is registered** under this Act, shall be punishable with **imprisonment for a term of not less than six months but up to three years**, or with a **fine of not less than one lakh rupees but up to five lakh rupees**, or with **both**.
Sections.Penalty for subsequent offence: Whoever, having already been convicted of an offence under this Act, is convicted again, shall be punishable for the **second and every subsequent offence** with **imprisonment for a term of not less than one year but up to three years**, or with a **fine of not less than two lakh rupees but up to twenty lakh rupees**, or with **both**.
Sections.No offence in certain cases: The provisions of this Act relating to offences are subject to the rights created and recognised by this Act, and **no act or omission shall be deemed to be an offence if it is permissible under this Act**.
Sections.Exemption of certain persons employed in: Where a person accused of an offence proves that in the **ordinary course of employment**, they acted **without any intention to commit the offence** and took all reasonable precautions, had no reason to suspect the genuineness of the act, and on demand, gave all information regarding the persons on whose behalf the offence was committed, they shall be **acquitted**.
Sections.Procedure where invalidity of registrati:
(1) If the offence relates to a registered variety and the accused pleads that the registration is **invalid**, and the court is *prima facie* satisfied that the offence is not tenable, it shall **adjourn the proceedings for three months** to allow the accused to file an application before the Registrar for **rectification of the Register** on the ground of invalidity.
(2) If the accused proves to the court that they made the application within the time limit or extended time, the further proceedings in the prosecution shall be **stayed** until the disposal of the rectification application.
(3) If the accused fails to apply to the Registrar within the three-month period (or extended time), the court shall proceed with the case **as if the registration were valid**.
(4) If a rectification application regarding the invalidity of the registration is already pending before the Registrar when the complaint is instituted, the court shall **stay the further proceedings** and determine the charge against the accused in conformity with the result of the rectification application.
Sections.Offences by companies:
(1) If the person committing an offence is a **company**, the **company as well as every person in charge of, and responsible to, the company** for the conduct of its business at the time of the offence shall be deemed **guilty** and liable to be proceeded against and punished. **Proviso**: Such person is not liable if they prove the offence was committed **without their knowledge** or that they exercised **all due diligence to prevent** the offence.
(2) If the offence was committed by a company with the **consent or connivance of, or is attributable to any neglect on the part of any director, manager, secretary, or other officer**, such individual shall also be deemed **guilty** and punished accordingly.
> **Explanation**: "company” includes a **firm** or other association of individuals; "director”, in relation to a firm, means a **partner**.

Act 6.Act Name: THE DESTRUCTIVE INSECTS AND PESTS (AMENDMENT AND VALIDATION) ACT, 1992

Sections.Short title: Destructive Insects and Pests (Amendment and Validation) Act, 1992
Rep. by the Repealing and Amending Act, 2001 (30 of 2001), s. 2 and Sch. (w.e.f. 3-9-2001)
Sections.Validation:
(1) Notwithstanding any judgment, decree or order of any court, tribunal or other authority,–– (i) the notification No.S.O.867(E), dated the 27th October, 1989 issued under sub-section (1) of the section 3 of the principal Act, and (ii) any fees levied or collected or purported to have been levied or collected for making an application for a permit to import, or for making inspection, fumigation, disinfection, disinfestation or supervision of, any article or class of articles or any insect or class of insects under the principal Act or the said notification, shall, for all purposes, be deemed to be and to have always been validly issued or, as the case may be, levied or collected in accordance with the provisions of section 3 of the principal Act as amended by this Act, and accordingly–– (a) no suit or other proceeding shall be maintained or continued in any court for the refund of any fees so collected; (b) no court or other authority shall enforce any decree or order directing the refund of any fees so collected; (c) any fees levied or purported to have been levied but not collected, may be recovered under the principal Act as amended by this Act; and (d) anything done or any action taken or purported to have been done or taken under or for the purposes of the principal Act shall be deemed to have been validly done or taken in accordance with law as if the provisions of section 3 of the principal Act, as amended by this Act, had been in force at all material times. 
(2) For the removal of doubts, it is hereby declared that nothing in sub-section (1) shall be construed as preventing any person–– (a) from questioning in accordance with the provisions of the principal Act, as amended by this Act, or the notification issued under section 3 of the principal Act, the levy or collection of such fees; or (b) from claiming refund of any fees paid by him in excess of the amount due from him under the principal Act, as amended by this Act, or the said notification.
Sections.Repeal and saving: (1) The Destructive Insects and Pests (Amendment and Validation) Ordinance, 1992 (Ord. 4 of 1992) is hereby repealed. (2) Notwithstanding such repeal, anything done or any action taken under the principal Act, as amended by the said Ordinance, shall be deemed to have been done or taken under the principal Act, as amended by this Act.

Act 7.Act Name: THE NATIONAL DAIRY DEVELOPMENT BOARD ACT, 1987

Sections.Short title and commencement:
(1) This Act may be called the **National Dairy Development Board Act, 1987**.
(2) It shall come into force on such date as the Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, appoint. (Note: The appointed date was 12th October, 1987.)
Sections.Declaration of National Dairy Developmen: The objects of the National Dairy Development Board at Anand in the State of Gujarat are such as to make the institution one of national importance, and it is hereby **declared that the National Dairy Development Board is an institution of national importance**.
Sections.Incorporation of National Dairy Developm:
(1) The National Dairy Development Board is hereby constituted a **body corporate** by the same name, having **perpetual succession and a common seal**, with power to acquire, hold, and dispose of property, to contract, and to sue and be sued.
(2) The **head office** shall be at **Anand in the State of Gujarat**.
(3) The Board may establish **units, offices, branches or agencies** in or outside India as it considers necessary.
Sections.Vesting of undertakings of Indian Dairy:
(1) On and from the appointed day, all the undertakings of the Indian Dairy Corporation shall stand **transferred to and vest in the National Dairy Development Board**.
(2) Notwithstanding the Companies Act, the **Indian Dairy Corporation shall, on and from the appointed day, stand dissolved** by virtue of this Act.
Sections.Effect of incorporation of National Dair:
On and from the appointed day:
(a) All **properties and assets**, movable and immovable, of the society and the Indian Dairy Corporation (dissolved company) shall **vest in the National Dairy Development Board**.
(b) All **rights, debts, liabilities, interests, privileges and obligations** of the society and the Indian Dairy Corporation shall stand **transferred to and be those of the National Dairy Development Board**.
(c) All debts, liabilities, obligations incurred, contracts entered into, and matters engaged to be done by the society or dissolved company immediately before the appointed day shall be **deemed to have been incurred, entered into, or engaged to be done by the National Dairy Development Board**.
(d) All sums of money due to the society and the dissolved company shall be **deemed to be due to the Board**.
(e) Every subsidiary of the society and the dissolved company shall **become the subsidiary of the National Dairy Development Board**.
(f) Every organisation managed by the society or dissolved company shall be **managed by the National Dairy Development Board** for such period, extent, and manner as required.
(g) Every organisation receiving financial, managerial, or technical assistance may **continue to be given such assistance** by the National Dairy Development Board as it deems fit.
(h) The amount representing the capital of the dissolved company shall **form part of the funds of the National Dairy Development Board**.
(i) Any reference to the society or the dissolved company in any other law, contract, or instrument shall be **deemed to be a reference to the National Dairy Development Board**.
Sections.Saving of legal proceedings: Any pending suit, arbitration, appeal, or other legal proceedings by or against the society or the dissolved company on the appointed day shall **not abate, be discontinued, or prejudicially affected** by the incorporation of the Board or dissolution of the Corporation. Such proceedings may be **continued, prosecuted, and enforced by or against the National Dairy Development Board**.
Sections.Terms of office and conditions of servic:
(1) The **Chairman** shall be the **Chief Executive** and hold office for the period determined by the Central Government, and is eligible for renomination.
(2) The Central Government may terminate the Chairman's services by giving **three months' notice or salary in lieu**. The Chairman may relinquish office by giving the Central Government **three months' notice**.
(3) The Chairman shall receive such **salary and allowances** as determined by the Central Government.
(4) A nominated whole-time director (executive) continues as an executive even after ceasing to be a director.
(5) The term of office for directors from State Co-operative Dairy Federations (c) shall **not exceed one year at a time**. The term for whole-time directors (d) and expert director (e) shall be determined by the Central Government.
(6) Every director, other than the Chairman, holds office **during the pleasure of the Central Government**.
(7) Directors in clauses (b), (c), and (e) shall be paid such **allowances** as the Central Government may determine.
Sections.Meetings of Board:
(1) The Board shall meet at the head office or any of its offices as the **Chairman may direct**, and shall observe **prescribed rules of procedure** (including quorum).
(2) The **Chairman** (or his nominee, or a director chosen by those present) shall **preside** at the meeting.
(3) Questions are decided by a **majority of votes**. In case of an equality of votes, the Chairman or person presiding shall have a **second or casting vote**.
(4) Every director, except as provided in sub-section (3), shall have **one vote**.
Sections.Manner of transacting business of Board:
(1) The Board shall act on **sound business principles with due regard to public interest**.
(2) The **Chairman** shall have the powers of **general superintendence, direction, control, and management** of the Board's affairs and may exercise all powers and do all acts of the Board.
(3) The Chairman may authorise any whole-time director to discharge his functions for a **temporary period** if he is unable to do so.
(4) In the absence of the Chairman and an authorised whole-time director, the powers may be exercised by the **senior-most whole-time director**.
Sections.Management committees:
(1) The Board may constitute such number of **management committees** as it deems fit to assist in the efficient discharge of its functions.
(2) A committee shall consist of members (directors or otherwise) as the Board determines, provided either the **Chairman or a whole-time director is a member**.
(3) Every committee functions under the **general control, direction, and superintendence of the Board**.
(4) The **minutes** of every committee meeting shall be **laid before the Board** as soon as possible.
Sections.Allowances, etc., of members of manageme:
(1) Members of a management committee, other than the Chairman and whole-time directors, may be paid such **prescribed allowances** for attending meetings or other work of the Board.
(2) All other matters pertaining to the **conduct of proceedings** of the committees shall be as prescribed.
Sections.Delegation of powers to management commi:
(1) The Board may delegate such of its powers and functions to any **management committee, member thereof, or officer of the Board**, subject to specified conditions and limitations, for efficient discharge of functions.
(2) The Board may, if considered necessary in the public interest, delegate any of its powers and functions to a **co-operative federation at the National or State level, or to any organisation owned, managed, controlled or assisted by the Board**.
Sections.Delegation of powers to whole-time direc:
The Board may, by order, delegate the powers of **appointment, termination, suspension, and dismissal** of employees, subject to general and special conditions, as follows:
(a) For employees drawing a salary in a prescribed **higher grade**, to a **whole-time director**.
(b) For employees drawing a salary in any other grade, to **such officer of the Board** as it deems fit.
> **Proviso**: For employees under clause (b), the **Chairman** may perform the Board's functions under this section if necessary or expedient.
Sections.Provisions regarding members of board of: Every person holding office as a member of the board of the society, or as a director of the dissolved company, immediately before the appointed day, shall **cease to hold office** as such member or director on and from that day.
Sections.Provisions relating to officers and othe: Subject to section 19, every full-time officer or other employee of the society or the dissolved company immediately before the appointed day shall **become an officer or employee of the National Dairy Development Board** on the same **terms and conditions of service** as previously, and shall continue to do so unless and until their terms and conditions are duly **altered by the Board**.
Sections.Power of Board to restructure and stream:
(1) The Board may make orders or take action for **restructuring and streamlining the organisational and functional set-up** to secure **utmost efficiency**.
* The Board is competent to **declare any officer or employee as redundant** if found surplus, due to duplication, absence of required special expertise, or non-availability of posts in a particular office/unit, making accommodation impracticable.
(2) Nothing shall preclude the Board from changing the **designation, conditions of service, scales of pay, or reallocating duties and functions** of transferred officers/employees for the purpose of rationalising their conditions of service.
Sections.Compensation for transfer of employees n: The transfer of services of any officer or employee from the society or dissolved company to the National Dairy Development Board shall **not entitle them to any compensation** under the Industrial Disputes Act, 1947, or any other law, and **no such claim shall be entertained** by any court, tribunal, or authority.
Sections.Provident fund, gratuity, welfare and ot:
(1) Where a provident fund has been
established by the society or the dissolved company in respect of either of them for the benefit of the
officers or other employees and the same stands vested in a trust, the moneys and other assets standing to
the credit of each provident fund shall continue to be held in trust with the same objects as were
applicable before the appointed day and the trustees of such trusts immediately before the appointed day
shall, subject to the provisions of the trust deeds and the rules relating to the respective trusts, continue to
function as trustees in respect of the respective provident fund until and unless otherwise directed by the
National Dairy Development Board, and the rights relating to the said trusts shall, as from the appointed
day, vest in the National Dairy Development Board.
(2) Where any gratuity, welfare or other fund had been established by the society or the dissolved
company for the benefit of its officers or other employees and is in existence immediately before the
appointed day, all moneys and other assets standing to the credit of or relatable to such gratuity, welfare
or other fund shall vest in the National Dairy Development Board.
(3) Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-sections (1) and (2), the Board may give such
directions relating to the trusts or funds or take such other action as it may deem fit so as to bring about
uniformity or to effect integration in part or in whole in such trusts or funds.
(4) The Board may, having regard to the welfare of the officers and other employees or their families,
take such steps for the advancement of their health, education or other interests as may be prescribed and
create such institutions as may be required for the purpose.
(5) Nothing in the foregoing provisions of this section shall derogate the power of the Board to make
regulations for establishing or maintaining any provident fund, welfare fund, gratuity fund or other fund
for any of its officers or other employees.
Sections.Borrowing powers of Board:
The Board may, with the previous approval of the Central
Government or in accordance with the terms of any general or special authority given to it by the Central
Government, borrow money from any source as it may deem fit for discharging all or any of its functions
under this Act.
Sections.Grants and loans by Central Government:
The Central Government may, after due
appropriation made by Parliament by law in this behalf, pay to the National Dairy Development Board by
way of grants or loans such sums of money as the Central Government may think fit for being utilised for
the purposes of this Act.
The National Dairy Development Board may receive gifts, grants,
donations or benefactions from Government or any other source in or outside India and the same shall be
used by the Board for exercising its functions and discharging its responsibilities under this Act.
(2) The National Dairy Development Board shall not receive any gifts, grants, donations or
benefactions from a foreign government or any other source outside India except with the previous
approval of the Central Government.
Sections.National Dairy Development Board Fund:
(1) The National Dairy Development Board shall
maintain a Fund to be called the National Dairy Development Board Fund to which shall be credited—
(a) all sums of money vested in the National Dairy Development Board under Chapter II;
(b) all sums of money that may be provided by Government;
(c) all fees and other charges received by the National Dairy Development Board;
(d) all sums of money generated from gift commodities by the National Dairy Development
Board or received by it by way of grants, donations, benefactions, bequests or transfers; and
(e) all sums of money received by the National Dairy Development Board in any other manner or
from any other source.
(2) All sums of money credited to the said Fund shall, subject to the regulations, if any, made in this
behalf, be deposited with the State Bank of India or any other nationalised bank.
Explanation.
—In sub-section “nationalised bank” means a corresponding new bank as defined in the
Banking Companies (Acquisition and Transfer of Undertakings) Act, 1970 (5 of 1970) and the Banking
Companies (Acquisition and Transfer of Undertakings) Act, 1980 (44 of 1980).
(3) The said Fund shall be applied towards meeting the administrative and other expenses of the
National Dairy Development Board, including expenses incurred in the exercise of the powers and the
discharge of its functions and responsibilities under section 16 or in relation to any of the activities
referred to therein or for anything relatable thereto.
Sections.Preparation of accounts and balance-shee:
(1) The balance-sheet and accounts of the
National Dairy Development Board shall be prepared in such form and in such manner as may be
prescribed.
(2) The Board shall cause the books and accounts of the National Dairy Development Board to be
closed and balanced as on the 31st day of March each year or such other date as the Board may, with the
concurrence of the Central Government, decide.
Sections.Audit:
(1) The accounts of the National Dairy Development Board shall be audited by auditors
duly qualified to act as auditors of companies under the Companies Act, and the appointment of auditors
and remuneration payable to them shall be subject to the approval of the Central Government.
(2) Every auditor in the performance of his duties shall have at all reasonable times access to books,
accounts and other documents of the National Dairy Development Board.
(3) The auditors shall submit their report to the Board which shall forward a copy of their report to
the Central Government.
Sections.Reports to be laid before Parliament:
The Central Government shall cause the report of the
auditors under section 28 to be laid before both the Houses of Parliament as soon as may be after such
report is received by the Central Government.
Sections.Power to call for repayment before agree:
Notwithstanding anything contained in
any agreement to the contrary, the Board may, by notice in writing, require any person to which the
National Dairy Development Board or the society or the dissolved company has granted any loan or
advance, to discharge forthwith in full, its liabilities to the Board,—
(a) if it appears to the Board that any false or misleading information in any material particular
was given in the application for the loan or advance; or
(b) if the person has failed to comply with the terms of its contract in the matter of the loan or
advance; or
(c) if there is a reasonable apprehension that the person is unable to pay his debts or that
proceedings for liquidation may be commenced in respect thereof; or
(d) if the property pledged, mortgaged, hypothecated or assigned as security for the loan or
advance is not insured and kept insured by the person to the satisfaction of the Board (or depreciates
in value to such an extent that, in the opinion of the Board, further security to the satisfaction of the
Board should be given and such security is not given after demand); or
(e) if, without due permission, any machinery, plant or other equipment (whether forming part of
security or not) is removed from the concerned premises without being replaced; or
(f) if it appears to the Board that any condition in the loan agreement relating to the supply of
goods or implementation of the project is being substantially violated; or
(g) if, for any other reason, the Board considers it necessary so to do for protecting the interests of
the National Dairy Development Board.
Sections.Special provisions for enforcement of cl:
(1) Where any person, in breach of any agreement, makes any default in the repayment of any
loan or advance or any instalment thereof (or in meeting its obligations in relation to the guarantee given
by the National Dairy Development Board) or otherwise fails to comply with the terms of agreement with
the Board or where the Board requires any person to make immediate repayment of any loan or advance
under section 30 and the person fails to make such repayment, then, without prejudice to the provisions of
section 69 of the Transfer of Property Act, 1882 (4 of 1882), any officer of the National Dairy
Development Board, generally or specially authorised by the Board in this behalf, may apply to the court
for one or more of the following reliefs, namely:—
(a) for an order for the sale of the property pledged, mortgaged, hypothecated or assigned to the
National Dairy Development Board as security for the loan or advance; or
(b) for transferring the management of any organisation to the National Dairy Development
Board; or
(c) for an	ad interim	injunction where there is apprehension that the machinery or other
equipment is being removed from the premises of the organisation without due permission.
(2) The procedure for making an application under sub-section (1) and for the disposal thereof shall
be such as may be prescribed.
Sections.Defects in appointments not to invalidat:
No act or proceeding of the
Board or of any committee of the National Dairy Development Board shall be questioned on the ground
merely of the existence of any vacancy in, or defect in the constitution of, the Board or the committee, as
the case may be.
Sections.Protection of acts done in good faith:
No suit or other legal proceeding shall lie against the
National Dairy Development Board or any director or any officer or other employee of the Board or any
other person authorised by the Board to discharge any functions under this Act, for any loss or damage
caused or likely to be caused by anything which is in good faith done or intended to be done in pursuance
of this Act or of any other law or provision having the force of law.
Sections.Indemnity of directors:
Every director shall be indemnified by the National Dairy
Development Board against all losses and expenses incurred by him, in, or in relation to, the discharge of
his duties, except such as are caused by his own wilful act or default.
Sections.Obligation as to fidelity and secrecy:
(1) The Board shall not, except as otherwise required by
this Act or any other law, divulge any information relating to, or to the affairs of, the National Dairy
Development Board or of the society or of the dissolved company except in circumstances in which it is
in accordance with the law or practice and usage customary among financial institutions, necessary or
appropriate for the Board to divulge such information.
(2) Every director, member of a committee, auditor or officer or other employee of the National Dairy
Development Board shall, before entering upon his duties, make a declaration of fidelity and secrecy in
the form set out in the Schedule.
Sections.Recruitment of additional officers and o:
Nothing contained in Chapter V
shall be deemed to prejudice the right of the National Dairy Development Board to create such number of
additional posts or to appoint such number of additional officers or other employees as it may consider
necessary or desirable for the efficient discharge of the functions of the National Dairy Development
Board and where any such officer or other employee is appointed, the terms and conditions of service,
including	inter se	seniority, may also be determined by the Board.
Sections.Liquidation only under orders of Central:
No provision of any law relating to
the winding up of companies or corporations shall apply to the National Dairy Development Board and it
shall not be placed in liquidation save by an order of the Central Government and in such manner as it
may direct.
Sections.Delegation of certain powers by Central:
(1) The Central Government may, on
the recommendation of the National Dairy Development Board, if satisfied that it is necessary so to do in
the public interest, make any scheme for the purpose of enabling the National Dairy Development Board
to undertake and perform any of the activities or functions of the Central Government relatable to dairy,
foodstuffs and connected industries, particularly with reference to matters related to the development of
the national milk grid by the regulation of the production, procurement, marketing, export-import,
maintenance of standards or such like activities (including the collection and compilation of statistics and
relevant data).
(2) Every scheme made under sub-section (1) shall be published in the Official Gazette and may
contain such conditions, restrictions or limitations as the Central Government may deem fit to impose.
Sections.Transitional provisions for auditors:
Any auditor appointed in relation to the society or the
dissolved company, functioning immediately before the appointed day, may, notwithstanding anything
contained in this Act, be continued by the National Dairy Development Board for such period and on
such terms as may be considered necessary.
Sections.Transitional provisions with regard to C:
The Chairman of the society,
holding office immediately before the appointed day, shall be the Chairman of the National Dairy
Development Board until a Chairman is nominated in accordance with the provisions of this Act and he
shall be competent to perform the functions of the Board until the constitution of the Board under this
Act.
Sections.Management or assistance to others to co:
For the removal of doubts, it is hereby
declared that where, before the appointed day, either the society or the dissolved company was managing
any other organisation or rendering any technical or other assistance to any organisation or person, the
National Dairy Development Board may continue to render the same or similar service to such extent,
for such period and with such modifications as the Board may deem fit.
Sections.Mother Dairy to be a subsidiary unit of:
The
undertaking known as the Mother Dairy, Delhi, shall, on and from the appointed day, become a
subsidiary unit of the National Dairy Development Board but shall retain its separate character, unless
otherwise decided by the Board.
Sections.Formation of companies with previous app:
(1) Where the
Board considers it necessary so to do, for the implementation of any of its objectives, it may, subject to
the previous approval of the Central Government form one or more companies either by itself or in
conjunction with any of its subsidiaries or with any other undertaking.
(2) Where any company has been formed in pursuance of sub-section (1),—
(a) in the case of a company formed by the Board by itself or along with its subsidiaries, it may
contribute such capital, transfer such of its assets or render such assistance, as may be required, so as
to enable the company so formed to function; and
(b) in any other case, it may contribute capital, transfer assets or render assistance in such manner
and to such extent as the Board may deem fit subject to specific previous approval of the Central
Government in that regard.
Sections.Returns:
The National Dairy Development Board shall furnish, from time to time, to the
Central Government such returns as the Central Government may require.
Sections.Power to make schemes and regulations re:
Any
scheme or regulation made under this Act in relation to conditions of service or like matters of officers or
other employees of the National Dairy Development Board, may be made retrospectively from any date
not earlier than the appointed day.
Sections.Act to have overriding effect:
The provisions of this Act shall have effect notwithstanding
anything inconsistent therewith contained in the Companies Act, the Industrial Disputes
Act, 1947 (14 of 1947) or any other law for the time being in force or in any instrument having effect by
virtue of any law other than this Act, or in any decree or order of any court, tribunal or other authority.
Sections.Power to remove difficulties:
(1) If any difficulty arises in giving effect to the provisions of
this Act, the Central Government may, by order, published in the Official Gazette, make such provisions
not inconsistent with the provisions of this Act as may appear to be necessary for removing the difficulty:
Provided that no such order shall be made after the expiry of five years from the appointed day.
(2) Every order made under this section shall be laid, as soon as may be after it is made, before each
House of Parliament.
Sections.Schemes and regulations to be laid befor:
Every scheme and every regulation
made under this Act shall be laid, as soon as may be after it is made, before each House of Parliament,
while it is in session, for a total period of thirty days which may be comprised in one session or in two or
more successive sessions, and, if, before the expiry of the session immediately following the session or
the successive sessions aforesaid, both Houses agree in making any modification in the scheme or
regulation or both Houses agree that the scheme or regulation should not be made, the scheme or
regulation shall thereafter have effect only in such modified form or be of no effect, as the case may be;
so, however, that any such modification or annulment shall be without prejudice to the validity of
anything previously done under that scheme or regulation.

Act 8.Act Name: THE MARITIME ZONES OF INDIA (REGULATION OF FISHING BY FOREIGN VESSELS) ACT, 1981

Sections.Short title and commencement:
(1) This Act may be called the **Maritime Zones of India (Regulation of Fishing by Foreign Vessels) Act, 1981**.
(2) It shall come into force on such date as the Central Government may, by notification in Official Gazette, appoint: Provided that different dates may be appointed for different provisions of this Act and any reference in any such provisions to the commencement of this Act shall be construed as a reference to the coming into force of that provision. (Note: The appointed date was 2nd November, 1981.)
Sections.Prohibition of fishing in maritime zones:
Subject to the provisions of this Act, **no foreign vessel shall** be used for fishing within any maritime zone of India, **except under and in accordance with**:
(a) a **licence** granted under section 4; or
(b) a **permit** granted under section 5, by the Central Government.
Sections.Grant of licences:
(1) The **owner of a foreign vessel** or any other person (not being an Indian citizen, Indian company, or Indian co-operative society) who intends to use such vessel for fishing within any maritime zone of India, may apply to the Central Government for a **licence**.
(2) Every application shall be in such form and accompanied by such **fees** as may be prescribed.
(3) No licence shall be granted unless the Central Government is **satisfied** (having regard to prescribed matters in the public interest and after necessary inquiry) that the licence may be granted.
(4) Every order granting or rejecting an application shall be **in writing**.
(5) A licence granted under this section:
(a) shall be in such **form** as may be prescribed;
(b) shall be valid for such **areas, period, method of fishing, and purposes** as specified therein;
(c) may be **renewed** from time to time; and
(d) shall be subject to such **conditions and restrictions** as may be prescribed and specified therein.
(6) A person holding a licence shall ensure that every person employed by him **complies** with the provisions of this Act, rules/orders, and the conditions of such licence.
Sections.Prohibition of fishing by Indian citizen:
(1) Every **Indian citizen** and every person who meets the Indian company or Indian co-operative society description (as per section 2(e)(II)(i)(2) or (3)), who intends to use any foreign vessel for fishing within any maritime zone of India, may apply to the Central Government for a **permit** to use such vessel.
(2) Every application shall be made in such form and accompanied by such **fees** as may be prescribed.
(3) No permit shall be granted unless the Central Government is **satisfied** (having regard to prescribed matters in the public interest and after necessary inquiry) that the permit may be granted.
(4) Every order granting or rejecting an application shall be **in writing**.
(5) A permit granted under this section:
(a) shall be in such **form** as may be prescribed;
(b) shall be valid for such **areas, period, method of fishing, and purposes** as specified therein;
(c) may be **renewed** from time to time; and
(d) shall be subject to such **conditions and restrictions** as may be prescribed and specified therein.
(6) A person holding a permit shall ensure that every person employed by him **complies** with the provisions of this Act, rules/orders, and the conditions of such permit.
(7) **Transitional Provision**: Any permission granted to an Indian citizen to use foreign fishing vessels immediately before the commencement of this Act, if its terms are not inconsistent with this Act, shall be **deemed to be a permit granted under this section** and shall continue in force on the same terms and conditions.
Sections.Cancellation or suspension of licence or:
(1) The Central Government may **suspend** a licence or permit pending inquiry if there is reasonable cause to believe the holder made a **materially incorrect or false statement** in the application/renewal or **contravened** the Act, rules, order, or licence/permit conditions.
(2) If, after inquiry, the Central Government is **satisfied** of such incorrect/false statement or contravention, it may **cancel** the licence or permit, without prejudice to any other penalty.
(3) A person whose licence or permit is suspended must **immediately stop** using the foreign fishing vessel and shall not resume until the suspension order is revoked.
(4) A holder of a suspended or cancelled licence or permit shall **immediately surrender** it to the Central Government.
Sections.Foreign vessel entering maritime zones o: Where any foreign vessel enters any maritime zone of India without a valid licence or permit, its **fishing gear** shall, at all times while it is in such zone, be **kept stowed in the prescribed manner**.
Sections.Fishing for scientific research, investi: Notwithstanding section 3, the Central Government may, in writing, **permit a foreign vessel to be used for fishing** within any maritime zone of India for **scientific research, investigation, or experimental fishing** in accordance with prescribed terms and conditions.
Sections.Penalty for contravention of section 3:
Where any foreign vessel is used in contravention of section 3, the owner or master shall be punishable:
(a) If contravention is in the **territorial waters of India**, with **imprisonment for up to three years or with fine up to rupees fifteen lakhs or with both**; and
(b) If contravention is in the **exclusive economic zone of India**, with **fine up to rupees ten lakhs**.
Sections.Penalty for contravention of licence: Whoever contravenes the provisions of any licence shall be punishable with **fine up to rupees ten lakhs**.
Sections.Penalty for contravention of permit:
Whoever contravenes the provisions of any permit shall be punishable:
(a) Where the contravention relates to the **area of operation or method of fishing** specified in the permit, with **fine up to rupees five lakhs**; and
(b) In any other case, with **fine up to rupees fifty thousand**.
(1) Where any person is convicted of an offence under section 10, 11 or 12, the **foreign vessel** used in connection with the offence, together with its **fishing gear, equipment, stores and cargo and any fish** on board (or the proceeds of sale of fish) shall also be **liable to confiscation**.
(2) The foreign vessel or other things confiscated shall **vest in the Central Government**.
Sections.Penalty for contravention of section 7: Where any foreign vessel is found in any maritime zone of India in contravention of section 7 (failure to stow gear), the owner or master shall be punishable with **fine up to rupees five lakhs**.
Sections.Penalty for obstruction of authorised of:
If any person:
(a) **intentionally obstructs** any authorised officer in exercising powers; or
(b) **fails to afford reasonable facilities** to the authorised officer or assistants to board the vessel or provide adequate security; or
(c) **fails to stop the vessel or produce documents/fish/equipment** when required to do so,
he shall be punishable with **imprisonment for up to one year or with fine up to rupees fifty thousand or with both**.
Sections.Court to pass certain orders: Where any person is convicted of an offence, the Court may, in addition to punishment, order that any **costs incurred in connection with the retention or custody of the vessel** (reduced by any amount realized from its use) shall be **payable by the person convicted**.
Sections.Offences by companies:
(1) Where an offence is committed by a **company**, every person who was **in charge of, and responsible to, the company** for the conduct of business, as well as the company, shall be deemed guilty and liable to be punished. 
**Proviso**: Such person shall not be liable if they prove the offence was committed **without their knowledge** or that they exercised **all due diligence** to prevent it.
(2) If an offence by a company is proved to have been committed with the **consent or connivance of, or is attributable to any neglect** on the part of, any **director, manager, secretary or other officer**, such individual shall also be deemed guilty and liable to be punished.
Explanation.—
(a) “company” means a body corporate and includes a **firm or other association of individuals**;
(b) “director”, in relation to a firm, means a **partner in the firm**.
Sections.Offences to be cognizable: Notwithstanding the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973, **every offence punishable under this Act shall be cognizable**.
Sections.Cognizance and trial of offences:
(1) No Court shall take cognizance of any offence except on a **report in writing** of the facts made by an **authorised officer**.
(2) No Court inferior to that of a **Metropolitan Magistrate or a Judicial Magistrate of the first class** shall try any offence under this Act.
Sections.Magistrate’s power to impose enhanced pe: Notwithstanding section 29 of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973, any Metropolitan Magistrate or Judicial Magistrate of the first class **specially empowered by the State Government** may pass any sentence **authorised by this Act**.
Sections.Place of trial: Any person committing an offence may be tried for the offence in such place as the **Central Government may, by general or special order, published in the Official Gazette, direct**.
Sections.Presumptions:
(1) The **place of commission** of an alleged offence shall be presumed on the basis of the **certified copy of the relevant entry in the log book or other official record of the vessel or aircraft** used for detection.
(2) Where a foreign vessel is found within any maritime zone of India and its fishing gear is **not stowed** in the prescribed manner or **fish is found on board**, it shall be **presumed, unless the contrary is proved, that the vessel was used for fishing** within that zone.
Sections.Protection of action taken in good faith:
(1) No suit, prosecution or other legal proceeding shall lie against any person for anything which is **in good faith done or intended to be done in pursuance of this Act**.
(2) No suit or other legal proceeding shall lie against the Government for any damage caused or likely to be caused for anything which is **in good faith done or intended to be done in pursuance of the provisions of this Act**.
Sections.Act to supplement other laws: The provisions of this Act shall be **in addition to and not in derogation of** the provisions of any other law for the time being in force.
Sections.Removal of difficulties:
(1) If any **difficulty arises** in giving effect to the provisions of this Act, the Central Government may, by order, published in the Official Gazette, make necessary provisions not inconsistent with the Act for **removing the difficulty**:
Provided that no such order shall be made after the **expiry of three years** from the commencement of this Act.
(2) Every order made shall be **laid before each House of Parliament**.

Sections.Short title, extent and commencement:
(1) This Act may be called the **Coconut Development Board Act, 1979**.
(2) It extends to the **whole of India**.
(3) It shall come into force on such date as the Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, appoint.
Sections.Declaration as to expediency of control: It is hereby declared that it is expedient in the public interest that the Union should take under its control the **coconut industry**.
Sections.Allowances payable to Chairman and membe: The **Chairman and members** of the Board shall receive such **allowances** as may be fixed by the Central Government.
Sections.Resignation of members: A member, other than an *ex officio* member, may **resign** by giving notice in writing to the Central Government; upon acceptance, the office is deemed vacated.
Sections.Officers of the Board and other staff:
(1) There shall be a **Chief Executive Officer** of the Board, not below the rank of Joint Secretary to the Government of India, appointed by the Central Government.
(1A) The Chief Executive Officer shall exercise such powers and perform such duties as may be **prescribed**.
(1B) The salaries and allowances payable to, and other conditions of service of, the Chief Executive Officer shall be such as may be **prescribed**.
(2) The Central Government shall appoint a **Chief Coconut Development Officer** to exercise prescribed powers and duties, or those delegated by the Chief Executive Officer.
(3) The Chief Coconut Development Officer shall have the right to attend meetings of the Board and its committees and take part in proceedings but **shall not be entitled to vote**.
(4) The Central Government shall appoint a **Secretary** to the Board who shall exercise prescribed powers and duties, or those delegated by the Board, the Chairman, or the Chief Executive Officer.
(5) The Chief Executive Officer, the Chief Coconut Development Officer, and the Secretary shall be entitled to such **salary and allowances** and subject to such conditions of service (leave, pension, provident fund, medical benefits) as may be fixed by the Central Government.
(6) Subject to control and restrictions, the Board may appoint **other officers and employees** for efficient performance; their appointment method, conditions of service, scales of pay/allowances shall be provided by **regulations**.
(7) The Chief Executive Officer, the Chief Coconut Development Officer, the Secretary, and other officers/employees **shall not undertake any work unconnected with their duties** under this Act except with the Central Government's permission.
Sections.Special provision for transfer of employ:
(1) Upon the Board's establishment, the Central Government may transfer, by order, any officer or employee from the **Directorate of Coconut Development** to the Board.
**First Proviso**: The scale of pay and other terms and conditions of service (including pension, leave, provident fund, medical benefits) for the transferred post **shall not be less favourable**.
**Second Proviso**: Protection of pay/allowances for the unexpired period of officiating in a higher post.
(2) Before transfer, employees of the Directorate must be given an **option** to express willingness or otherwise to become Board employees; the option is final.
**First Proviso**: No transfer order shall be made for an employee who has intimated their intention of **not becoming a Board employee**.
**Second Proviso**: Persons not opting to become Board employees shall be dealt with in the same manner as Central Government employees in the event of departmental strength reduction.
(3) A transferred employee ceases to be a Central Government employee and becomes a **Board employee**, governed by Board regulations (subject to provisos to sub-section (1)). Until Board regulations are framed, relevant Central Government rules/orders apply.
(4) If a question arises whether the terms and conditions in Board regulations are less favourable than those immediately before transfer, the **Central Government's decision shall be final**.
Sections.Committees of the Board:
(1) The Board may appoint such **committees** as may be necessary for the efficient discharge of its duties.
(2) The Board may **co-opt** non-members to any committee; co-opted persons may attend meetings and participate in proceedings but **shall not have the right to vote**.
(3) Co-opted members shall be entitled to receive such **allowances or fees** for attending meetings as fixed by the Central Government.
